Wheres muskymatt PRAISE ELFIE  The biggest story of the day however might be Daniel Alfredsson who is leaving the Ottawa Senators after 17 seasons in the nation's capital. According to TSN Hockey Insider Darren Dreger, the long-time Ottawa captain made the Senators aware of his decision on Thursday night and will sign a one-year, $5.5 million contract with the Detroit Red Wings. Last season, Alfredsson scored 10 goals and 16 assists in 47 games. He also added 4 goals and 10 points in 10 playoff games. The native of Gothenburg, Sweden has spent his entire career with Ottawa, scoring 426 goals and adding 682 assists in 1,178 games. The 40-year-old veteran was originally selected in the sixth round by the Senators at the 1994 NHL Entry Draft.  This is ensane   The Red Wings also landed former Florida Panther centre Stephen Weisswith a five-year, $24.5 million contract.  Weiss, the 4th overall pick in the 2001 draft, played in just 17 games for the Panthers last season due to a wrist injury but had scored at least 20 goals in each of the three previous seasons. Heading to Ottawa meanwhile, is left-winger Clarke MacArthur who signed a two-year $6.5 million dollar deal with the Senators. MacArthur, who was originally drafted 73rd overall by Buffalo in 2003, scored eight goals and 20 points for the Maple Leafs last season.
Bobby Ryan traded to the sens....that should help easy the the pain of losing whats his face!!!!
sign a one-year, $5.5 million contract with the Detroit Red Wings.  I,ll bet,it,s his last year too. An easy 5.5 retirement fund. LOL

So let me get this straight... The Leafs sign Bozak, who has only broken 40pts once and has never potted 20goals, and Clarkson, who makes Komisarek look like an Olympic speed skater and averages 29 pts per season to contracts in excess of 4 mil each? In the process lost Clarke MacArthur who signed for 2, not 7, years at a little over 3mil per? Its official, I threw up all over myself.
Drama, it's happening again, lol.  May I suggest a few ice cold Coors Lights to help with your ailment.

Grabo was overpaid by a million or so but he was a solid forward and not all of what he contributed can be measured easily with traditional stats. I'm certainly not heart broken by the buyout, but on the other hand I'll judge it based on who, and for how much, they get this summer.

Carlyle misplayed Lupul out of town in Ana as well. Looking at it from that point of view tells that neither of them (Lupul in Ana and Grabs now) were very good defensively. Still fuming over the buyout and dont think Weiss, who is only a marginal upgrade at this point for a guy picked 4th overall, is the answer. Neither is Bozak. I really think Carlyle made a poor decision here, but am really appreciating the fact that Nonis is holding everybody accountable. Gonna miss 94. Loved watching him buzzsaw all over the place. Some lucky team is going to get a very motivated player at a very reasonable price.  Have to add, search out Jonas Siegels twitter. Grabs parting words on Carlyle made me laugh

Previous stats don't mean anything. A 5m player should be consistent. It's obvious Carlyle doesn't like him, so what's the point in keeping an overpaid player who won't preform to his abilities. I'm sure another team will pick him up for less quickly

He's 34. He's under contract for 9 more years (50 plus million dollars). For over a year his GM, coach and many fans have not wanted him. I think he checked out at the end of the season, if not sooner. Luongo is a solid goalie, his cap hit isn't bad, but the term is awful.
